name: Zoetry Paraiso de la Bonita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the best vacation ever - did not want to leave. Great resort with staff that wants to make your visit enjoyable. Great food & drink, breakfast service a little slow. Nothing can beat laying by the pool or beach & having someone check on you & bring drinks & food - you don't have to leave your spot all day if you don't want to! A drawback were the mesquitos in the room (but not around the pool or restaurants); aslo they need a DVD player in the bedroom as well as the living area. In room dining was also great.
reviews.title: Romantic Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Zoetry is a fantastic smaller resort with a beautiful beach. We arrived two days before hurricaine Ida passed by the costal areas, the beach were covered in sea weed. The weather was cloudly with rain of course with the system passing close to the resort. The staff we all great and friendly, food was great, rooms were large. But on the bottom floor you have some bugs that come in the door when opened, the swamp is behind the resort so lots of mosquitos. Bring OFF
reviews.title: Find youself in a hurricaine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So what do ypu do for four days while the weather clears? There were a few things to do but being a smaller resort it was limited. The spa was excellent my wife said. So the resort is a spa and wellness retreat. My wife and I met this fabulous person Charles Wills. I thought it was my wife who need to relax but I found myself that I was the one who neede help. I'm sleeping better and have lost over five pounds in two weeks wit his help. I encourage you to visit his web site www.theWillsSystem.com to get more info.
reviews.title: Endless Privileges = Endless Waiting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall we had a good time to reconnect, it would have been better if the weather had cooperated but thats life.
reviews.title: A beautiful, relaxing experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from staying here eight days and seven nights. This is a truly beautiful place visually but not without problems. The worst is management and communication. First our pickup at the airport didn't show for over 40 minutes (Also they don't meet you inside, you have to go outside and look for your name), then when he did show up, we had to share the ride with another couple. So we had no champagne or cool towels described in the other reviews. We talked to other couples and found out some had to wait for over an hour for their ride. When we got to the resort, there was no one there to meet us. After about five minutes someone came to greet us and give us the tour. It really is a very beautiful resort. The suite with the the plunge pool was perfect, except the pool only really gets sun until 1 as does the hotel pool. So you need to get your sun time in early. Also if your booking a suite get a corner one as they get more sunlight on the pool. Ours was named Delhi and was very nice. The marble tub was great but they don't give you bath salts or bubbles for the bath. They also don't sell them in the gift shop. Very strange,,,, to have such a beautiful tub with candles and no bath salts or bubbles. The beach is disgusting,,,, if your going for the beach, cancel. It looks nothing like the website shot. We saw all kinds of garbage (plastic jugs, motor oil containers, shoes, etc) Plus the water is all brown and full of sea weed. There is a John Deer tractor that goes up and down the beach all morning. It doesn't clean the sand but just chomps up the garbage into smaller pieces. I would not walk barefoot on this beach. This is not the place for people who love the beach!!!!! The beach chairs are also plastic and broken. Not what you would expect from this kind of resort and prices. I thought the food was great but the service is TERRIBLE!!!! I think the previous reviewers had great service because the resort wasn't full. The one day they weren't full the service was much better but the rest of the time it was awful. Room Service takes at least a hour to a hour and a half for anything and then they always forget something. One day breakfast just never showed up. The wine tasting was very nice but not the cooking class. The cooking class was just standing around the sushi bar watching him make a sushi roll,,,, hardly what I would call a cooking class with a chief,,,,,LOL. I mean, shouldn't you even cook something? The spa is amazing as was our massages. I heard the resort is under new management so you can't really go by past reviews or all the awards they won as that wining team is gone. We talked to a lot of others couples and everyone seemed to feel the same (One women gave me my review title). The hotel maintenance was amazing, they come right away to fix anything! One last thing, bring lots of singles to tip. Even though they say tipping is included, everyone wants a tip but sadly even if you tip the service doesn't really get any better, they just won't forget to come back, Hopefully. LOL.
reviews.title: Lifechanging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If there a heaven on earth, you will find it at Zoetry! And for the rest of my life I plan on being very,very good so I can get back there ASAP. From the moment you arrive you are welcomed with excellence of service and kindness. The suites are like staying in a surreal dream. Food is fresh,creative,absolutely delicious. The beach and pools are as perfectly maintained as if brand new. What makes Zoetry worthy of heaven status is absolutely their people. This much attention to detail could not be accomplished without people excellence. I brought my IPOD and a book I never listened or read. I didn't want to fill my brain or soul with anything other than Zoetry. Their kindness,sincerity in care and service coupled with the natural beauty of this place should be the standard that all inclusive packages should be held to. If you choose to make this your heaven,you will not be disappointed. If you are disappointed IT'S YOU. If you're lucky enough to go to Zoetry, you're lucky enough indeed!
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for an anniversary this year. Rooms were nice enough. Property is very small - you can walk the length of it in 5 minutes - forget a "long walk on the beach". The worst part is the food - billed as a health spa resort - couldnt be further fromt he truth. Almost all the food is "fruify". Only 2 restaurants - one is a French wannabe that serves jellied eggplant and pastry you can fit on the end of your pinkie fingernail - not what one things of when you think upscale restaurant - perhaps that is what they think it means in Cancun.
reviews.title: Pure bait and switch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That leaves you with one restaurant - which after a couple days gets pretty boring. When we asked for fresh berries - we got a plate - with 4 raspberries. When we asked for more the waiter said "really?".
reviews.title: Great but not without issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are frequently there - and when they are not - they are always watching you. Pictures of the wife/owner are everywhere in every building. Pictures of them with famous people etc. Why they think a traveller paying to stay there gives two hoots who they know I will never be able to tell. Ego centric to the core. Each room doesn't have a # - but is rather the name of a place the owners have vacationed - give me a break.
reviews.title: Great place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Signed up for the daily class (exercise, wine tasting etc.), more than half the time the instructor didn't show up.
reviews.title: Beautifully designed resort, peaceful setting, amazing staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food, excellent. Lets start there. We arrived with Hurricane Ida and this was no fault of the hotel but we could not check in because of floods, received no information when taken to the room. The manager was off that day so we did not get a tour. Three of the 4 restaurants where closed because of the weather and one of the two was down because of a group which arrived. My only concern here was when we had to eat at Kaax after the 6th day we would have liked to see a second menu, even a rainy day menu so as to try something different. The older waiter even made use feel foolish when on the first day he gave us a look like your going to eat all that and we cut back our order to find we would have been fine. One day we could not even get food as all the bar seats where taken and we had to return to our room and order room service because both restaurants where closed(and we where not the only one's looking for lunch). We where not informed of the daily outing so when we found them on the things to do today sheet we went to sign up. They where all taken and the staff did not say well lets make sure we get you down for the rest, they never told us about then and had to return three times to find out they where all filled. Our daily shopping trip was canceled due to the weather but they had 4 cars owned by the resort and never did the manager offer to drive us in since they never even called the room to tell us the trip had been canceled. We where up at 630 so we could get ready and eat before leaving at 9AM.
reviews.title: As a Travel Agent..I have mixed feelings about Zoetry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to the Talasso spa in Tahiti I had expected a little more. Maybe lotions out to assist you in getting ready. I told the girls in the dressing room they where out of berry tea and I was told they would get right on that, but when I returned 2 days later the same empty tin was sitting back in its place.
reviews.title: My new favorite place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms where nice and large but they never replaced shampoos until we called for them, don't know why. The tequila we had when we arrived was enjoyed by all, and I do mean all. We had three shots and the last day I said have you been drinking the Quillan to my boyfriend and he said , a couple shots. I said well there is only and inch left. We left for breakfast, some cleaning was delivered and then we only had about 1/2 an inch left. I just wonder what they used to drink it with...eeek.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the laundry service was a great idea and we sent our clothers we wore out almost every day, it was nice to retun home with clean clohtes.
reviews.title: Zoetry-Zen, Relaxation, Romance- AMAZING!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had emailed the hotel several times to let them know we woudl be celebrating our anniversary and nothing, not a note or mention.
reviews.title: Service was excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from 5 days at this resort. The location of this resort is perfect. Just 20 minutes from the airport. No other resorts around and a beautiful beach. We were met at the airport by the driver who was waiting outside. The service at the hotel is great. Everyone is very friendly and attentive. You can ask for anything and they will do there best to accomodate you . We had a room with a plunge pool that was 10 feet from the beach. The room was very nice with a separate liviing area and beautiful bathroom. It was so quiet at night that we never heard another person. There are 3 restaurants but you can order anything that you want and they will make it for you. The food was good but not great . The best restaurant is Canoa which was a great experience. The pool area is very nice . The beach has cabanas which are wonderful and they will bring you drinks and food all day long. I would also recommend the spa where I had one of the best massages. Overall this was a wonderful hotel if a bit overpriced for what you get.
reviews.title: relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travels to Mexico have always been beautiful. Paraiso de la Bonita was another fabulous resort to add to our list. I do not usually write about our travels. I am adding this blurb to trip advisor because Paraiso de la Bonita’s website is missing very important information that you should know about. There is a man named Charles who lives and works at the resort as a health and wellness professional. Here is his website http://www.thewillssystem.com . I had read about Charles in another review and just knew that I had to meet him. After speaking with him for about 15 minutes, he told us our numbers and how they reveal personality traits about a person. This was very intriguing, because everything he was saying was correct. He knew that I was sensitive, and that I have a hard time letting things go. He knew that I am the kind of person to notice a butterfly behind a crowd of people. Because of his insight, he was easily able to determine how he could help us to manage our health and well being. We set up an appointment and Charles visited our room for about 1 and ½ hours. He hooked each of us up to finger clip pulse monitors and connected them to his laptop. He then used this software which enabled us to see our heart beating in real time as well as our breath. Both of us were breathing much faster than what is considered to be healthy. Charles said that most people do not know how to breathe correctly because we are always in a state of fight or flight. He used another interactive program to help us to control our breathing. At the end of our session, both of us showed great improvement when our hearts and breathing were monitored again. It was such a drastic difference that if we implement these practices at home and in our daily lives, we are convinced that we will lead even healthier lives and may even add on an extra 10- 15 years. I would highly recommend taking a few minutes out of your day just to meet Charles. He is an extraordinarily magnetic person who will bring nothing but positive energy your way.
reviews.title: Art, Romance, Health and Well Being, Exporation, and Fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another thing that you may not know about is the Jungle Place. Nobody at Paraiso de la Bonita had ever heard of it. It is this amazing monkey sanctuary that is about an hour away from the resort. Here is the website in case you are interested in making a reservation to handle, feed, play with, and love a great group of monkeys. www.thejungleplace.com You will need to make a reservation prior to your arrival, as Heidi and Joel only allow a few visitors per day. You can pay via paypal. It is $30.00 per person, and well worth it. Also, be sure to bring Heidi’s phone number with you in case you need to call her for directions. The location is a little tricky to find. I will attach one of the many pics from this experience.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort: Beautiful. Parrots, peacocks, Iguanas, pelicans, guinea hens and other fun animals live on the grounds. Rooms are all beachfront suites. Pools are gorgeous. Art collection is diverse. There is even a sculpture in the pool. We had the best massages of our lives at the spa. Spa facilities were wonderful. La Canoa was the best restaurant. We would recommend arranging for a private dinner on the pier. Hector was our server when we arranged for this, and he was delightful. He set up candles and flower petals that lead to the pier, as well as palm branches along the pier. The table was decorated with flowers and at the end of our meal, three guitarists walked out to play just for us. There is a daily boat that leaves from the pier at noon that will take you to Puerto Morelos and returns at 3pm. We would highly recommend taking the sunset cruise on the resort’s private Catamaran. If you have time, you can arrange to go on a private snorkeling trip with Saul. The resort is located right next to the second largest barrier reef in the world, the second being in Australia. Rise early in the morning, go outside and lay in one of the beach beds to catch a beautiful sunrise. I could go on and on, but mostly everyone else has posted all of the amazing attributes of Paraiso, so I hope that my review has offered even more insight to what you will experience.
reviews.title: Pampered in paradise, mark and christine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Zoetry defines perfection. From the moment we arrived, we knew this would be a vacation of a lifetime. This facility would impress even those with the most discerning tastes.
reviews.title: Zoetry is the place to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a great trip to this resort. The resort was nearly empty, lending to tons of privacy and serenity, but almost an awkward staff to guest ratio. (We felt bad that some of the staff seemed to have not much to do and might not be making that much money due to the low guest numbers. However they were all very friendly and accomodating.) Frederico, by the pool, was amazing. The property is gorgeous and very well maintained. The pool area is one the best I've seen in Carribean/ Mexico travel. We practically lived in the heated salt water pool. The room was very pretty and the maids were excellent, visitng 3 times per day.
reviews.title: Great but not THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Endless Privledges" package is great. We left our children home, so it was great to have free international calling from anywhere in the hotel so we could call home often. Also they did our laundry every day at no extra charge. The food is good, but tiresome after day 3 or so. When dining at La Canoa, be warned that dinner can take 3 hours or more. The Grille area is a casual option and very good food.
reviews.title: Luxurious Resort for Quiet, Romance & Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truth be told, we probably should have picked the Rosewood Myakoba to take it a step above, even though it would have cost about 30% more. (Paraiso is a great value right now) Upon arriving at the airport, the transfer from the hotel was 30 minutes late, leaving us easy prey for the Cancun cabbies. (Rosewodds driver was right on time) And no one seemed too apoligetic at the hotel about it. The beds are hard as rocks, this is no exaggeration, but we think it has something to do with the wellness factor of the hotel. It might be good for you? The gym was about 100 degrees and not too great for a resort that markets itself as a wellness resort.
reviews.title: Spectacular! Beautiful surroundings, outstanding service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all, we had a nice relaxing week and we would definitley suggest it, but we're Rosewood fans at heart, and this was no Rosewood.
reviews.title: Such an amazing experience I planned another trip before I even left...the place and the people are charming...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from the most relaxing vacation of our lives at Zoetry Paraiso de la Bonita. Please believe all of the wonderful information that you've already read and then be prepared for your expectations to be exceeded.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a 4 night stay at Paraiso de la Bonita. The entire experience was fabulous! Paraiso is the perfect spot for a quiet, relaxing, romantic getaway. The service, accommodations, location, staff, amenities, and spa are all top notch. The real highlight of our trip, however, was our time with Charles Wills, Wellness Director. He was absolutely fantastic! We met with him several times over the course of our stay. His knowledge of stress management and a balanced lifestyle is limitless. His techniques are effective and easy to use. Since our return home, my husband and I have been using the knowledge gained from Charles in our everyday lives. He is an incredible asset to the resort and we feel blessed to have spent time with him!
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint with Paraiso was the limited selection of vegetarian offerings, particularly at dinner. My husband and I are both vegetarians. One of our primary reasons for deciding on Paraiso for our getaway was the fact that it is a "wellness resort". The website touts their wide selection of organic cuisine, including gourmet vegetarian options. We did not experience this. Our first night, we had dinner at Kaax. There was not one vegetarian entree on the menu. We asked our waiter to talk with the chef and see what he could come up with. He returned and said the chef could do pasta with vegetables. Needless to say we were a little disappointed. The last thing two vegetarians want to hear is that they're paying $1000+ a night for pasta primavera! When our dinners arrived, we were staring at two plates of linguini with what looked like a bag of frozen vegetables dumped on top. We were definitely not happy. After complaining the next morning, our dinners definitely improved. However, we would have loved to see some more creative options.....perhaps something with tofu or seitan.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, our stay was fantastic and exactly what we needed. We would definitely recommend this resort and plan to return!
reviews.title: Paraiso was amazing!

likes.liked: — Our experience with The Wellness Director, Charlie Wills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel - Staff was very professional and friendly and made every effort to make our stay wonderful. The food, drinks and spa were excellent - would rank food 5 star. We have been to many "all inclusive" and this was the best - not a buffet to be found
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

likes.disliked: — Had to leave! Beach next door was untended and dirty with plastic items

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very quiet hotel - especially at night - very relaxing but if you are looking for night life - this is not the spot.
reviews.title: Great for R n R

likes.disliked: — not much to do other than lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading Tripadvisor's glowing reviews and checking the Paraiso de la Bonita website, I made reservations for the week of New Year's at Paraiso. This was our first visit to Puerto Morelos. We arrived on 12/28 and were met by a driver in an SUV for transport to the hotel. We were greeted with a delicious iced tea made with cinammon and escorted to our room. As a matter of fact, we ordered the tea every day for the rest of the week.
reviews.title: Not What I Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being escorted to our room, we did feel as though the staff person should have explained much more about the resort to us. We did not have the resort folder in our room with room service menus, etc. and were told when we requested one that they did not have any more. It took four days and a trip to the concierge to get one and then pages were missing and we had no idea what was offered for room service.
reviews.title: Airport pickup in the private Lincoln Navigator was just the beginning...

likes.disliked: — Not the best beach in the world ... but the beach wasn't important to us ... everything else at the resort made up for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wait staff was the highlight of our stay. They made a point to learn our names. They were attentive at the restaurants, room service and at the pools. My hat's off to whoever trains them. There kindness seemed very genuine.
reviews.title: Why can't all hotels be like this?

likes.liked: — The views, the interior design and the clothes facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Lover's Suite for the week. Nice, but we've stayed at nicer....and at the same price (about $11K). We battled mosquitos the entire week even though the resort sprayed with chemicals outside almost every day. (Not sure if it was DDT or what). I came home with about 15 mosquito bites and my husband had four. Not very pleasant.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was very good especially Chiringuito which is an outdoor grill near the pools. We were, however, disappointed in the meal on New Year's Eve. We spent nearly $1000 on a set menu that was awful. The worst foie gras I have ever had and a conch appetizer that tasted like a rubber shoe. The best part was the entertainment after the meal.
reviews.title: Serenity on the Mayan Riveria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Zoetry Paraiso over Thanksgiving, and had the most amazing time. This resort is completely in a class of its own. We've been to this area three times before, and this is hands-down the best. Hands down. The best.
reviews.title: Amazing - Paradise Found - Don't Hesitate, Just Go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel quite frequently, and haven't seen a property like this in any of our other trips, having the combination of amazing amenities, food, and impeccable service. The clientele was a mix of normal people, and some exceptionally rich people. Even though we fell into the normal people category, we felt like celebrities the entire week.
reviews.title: Best thing about this hotel is Charles Wills and the Wills System.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds were amazing, and the food was so good (which is actually a first for us at any of the five-star places we've stayed in Mexico, where the food is usually only so-so). All of the rooms are full ocean front suites. However, the real star was the service. Some examples: they knew our names, food, drink, and shade preferences from the first day. (They'd see us coming, set up a beach chair, and bring an umbrella for us, while greeting us by name and offering to bring us drinks.) As we checked in to our amazing room, I mentioned out loud "wow, it'd be great if there were a hammock on our balcony!" Well, guess what, when we returned to our room later, there was a hammock installed. Stuff like that, all week long.
reviews.title: Zoetry - Paradise on Earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We've stayed before at: Excellence Playa Mujeres, El Dorado Seaside Suites, Xpu-ha Palace. They were all good (except playa mujeres, at which we had some issues), but seriously, this resort was so so much better, I honestly can't even compare. If you can swing it financially to upgrade to this resort, it'll be totally worth it. (We got a good deal through worry free vacations, much cheaper through our travel agent than online.)
reviews.title: great value and service enjoyed my experience at the wellness center with Charles Wills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One negative: bring bug spray. I got some bug bites at the Kaax restaurant one night after it had rained briefly in the afternoon. That was the only day we would have needed it. Can't think of any other negatives, except perhaps a wider range of wines to be included on the "free" list. (There's a massive list for additional wines.)
reviews.title: Best Wedding Destination in Mexico

aka: Zoetry Paraiso De La Bonita Hotel Puerto Morelos
description: Mexico's famed Paraiso de la Bonita Resort, a Leading Small Hotels of the World, Virtuoso member and four-time winner of the prestigious AAA Five Diamond Award is tucked into a protected private Beach just 15 minutes from the Cancun International airport. The ultra-luxury boutique beachfront resort is considered the most exclusive property in its category in Cancun's Riviera Maya region. Each of the 90 lavish oceanfront suites is uniquely decorated with hand-picked treasures and feature private terraces, luxurious bathroooms with Bvulgari bath amenities, Frette robes and towels and spacious living room. The resort is home to North America's first certified Thalassotherapy Spa, which combines the ocean's most beneficial elements with state of the art equipment and techniques. In addition, the property's private 48 ft. Catamaran treats guests to a delightful experience on the beautiful waters of the Mexican Caribbean.
